meanings.definition: To make (something) completely free from faults or defects.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours perfecting her painting, making sure every detail was just right.
meanings.sent2: He is constantly perfecting his recipe for chocolate chip cookies to make them even more delicious.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to keep perfecting its dance moves until it could outshine any human dancer.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to perfecting her craft turned her into a master artist admired by all.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor chiseled away at the marble, perfecting the statue's likeness to perfection.

meanings.definition: To improve or refine (something) to achieve the highest possible standard.
meanings.sent1: With each practice session, she was perfecting her tennis serve, aiming for precision and power.
meanings.sent2: The chef was constantly perfecting his signature dish, ensuring it was a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The magician kept perfecting his disappearing act, much to the confusion of his audience.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to perfecting her skills in archery made her an unbeatable competitor.
meanings.sent5: The tailor meticulously worked on perfecting the fit of the wedding gown, ensuring the bride looked stunning.

meanings.definition: To bring (something) to completion or full development.
meanings.sent1: The final touches on the project were all about perfecting the details before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was perfecting the layout of the flower beds to create a harmonious garden.
meanings.sent3: The scientist was so close to perfecting the formula for the new medicine, he could almost taste success.
meanings.sent4: The composer spent months perfecting the symphony, ensuring every note was in its rightful place.
meanings.sent5: The architect was in the process of perfecting the design of the skyscraper, aiming for both beauty and functionality.
